isis.stitle: International® MaxxForce™ 5 Engine Service Manual - Power Cylinder - Cleaning, Inspection, and Measurement - Connecting Rods

caution.para: To prevent engine damage, the connecting rod cap fractured mating surfaces must be assembled onto the original connecting rod and in the original orientation (matching numbers must be adjacent to each other).

To prevent engine damage, keep the fractured mating surfaces clean and free of debris. Do not allow mating surfaces to rest on any other surface. Do not bump mating surfaces or drop the connecting rod or cap. This could cause wear and chipping of the fractured surface, resulting in improper mating during installation and possible engine damage.

step1.para: Inspect connecting rod bolts for nicks or damage. Replace as required.
Inspect connecting rod and cap mating surfaces and bearing bore for any indication of damage. Bore must be smooth and free of scoring or nicks. Replace as required.

step2.para:
Using a Telescoping Gauge and a 1-2 inch micrometer, measure pin bore at two locations approximately 90° apart. Record the measurements. See Special Service Tools
.

If inside diameter of piston pin bushing exceeds specification, replace connecting rod. See Specifications
.
